subcategories.name: For Siblings
questions: What’s your earliest memory of us being partners in crime?
What’s one thing you admire about me but never said out loud?
What’s a childhood rumor or “fact” you believed way too long?
What’s the funniest fight we ever had growing up?
What’s one thing you think we learned from our parents differently?
What’s a moment where you actually felt proud of me?
If we swapped lives for a day, what would you fail at first?
What’s a habit of mine that secretly annoys you?
Which childhood tradition do you wish we could bring back?
What’s one thing I used to do that made you feel cared for—knowingly or unknowingly?
What’s a childhood memory you think shaped us both?
What’s something you think we need to do more often as siblings?
What was the moment you realized we were growing up?
What’s one thing you miss about how things used to be?
What’s an inside joke we should never let die?
Who was more dramatic growing up — be honest?
What’s one thing you think I should stop worrying about?
What’s something we used to fight about that feels hilarious now?
What’s a life lesson you think I still need to learn?
What’s something you think we’d crush as a team?
What’s one moment you realized I had your back no matter what?
What’s a silent battle you think I might be fighting right now?
If we wrote a “siblings rulebook,” what’s rule number one?
What’s something we should plan together this year?
What’s one thing from our childhood that shaped who you are today?
What’s something you wish we talked about more often?
What’s a memory of us that always makes you smile?
What’s one thing you want us to do differently moving forward?
What’s a trait you think we both inherited?
What’s something you love about us as siblings?

subcategories.name: Deep Questions
questions: What’s one truth about our family that took you years to understand?
What’s a childhood wound you think you’re still healing from?
What’s one thing you wish our family talked about openly?
What emotion do you hide the most around family — and why?
Do you think we grew up too fast or just in time?
What’s one thing you’re grateful happened exactly the way it did?
What’s a decision you think shaped your life forever?
What’s a belief you unlearned as you grew older?
What’s one moment you felt truly understood by someone in the family?
When was the last time you felt overwhelmed but stayed quiet?
What’s a responsibility you wish you didn’t carry so early in life?
What’s one hard truth you think most families avoid?
What’s something you’re scared to admit—even to yourself?
Where do you feel the safest emotionally?
What’s one feeling you’ve struggled to explain to others?
What’s a moment you realized you were stronger than you thought?
How different is your real personality from your “family version”?
When was the last time you felt disappointed in yourself?
What’s one belief or value you’ll carry forever?
What’s something you want to heal before it affects your future?
What’s one truth you think everyone eventually learns the hard way?
What do you think your younger self would say to you now?
What’s one memory that still feels heavier than it should?
Who in the family do you feel closest to emotionally — and why?
What’s a lesson life taught you that school never could?
What’s one question you wish someone asked you more often?
What’s something you’re still trying to forgive yourself for?
When do you feel the most alone?
What’s one change you wish your family would make collectively?
What’s something you want to finally let go of?
